text: Chuck Hagel on @JoeBiden: Joe’s a Democrat. I’m a Republican, but that never mattered to Joe. He always understood that what matters most in public life, as in all things in life, is character. That public service is a privilege to be earned, and it’s its own best reward

text: .@JoeBiden on climate change: It’s a threat to our economic vitality, a threat to our national security, a threat to our very survival.
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JoeBiden: Today we face a great global danger, one that threatens every aspect of human life, and there are still too many who refuse to recognize climate change for what it is. It is an existential threat.

text: .@JoeBiden receiving the Global Visionary Award from @ConservationOrg in New York tonight. Former Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos is also receiving the award tonight

text: Deval Patrick on his decision not to run for president in 2020: Knowing that the cruelty of our elections process would ultimately splash back on people whom Diane and I love, but who hadn’t signed up for the journey, was more than I could ask. https://www.facebook.com/6290032613/posts/10155021358512614/ …
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Deval Patrick makes it official: After a lot of conversation, reflection and prayer, I’ve decided that a 2020 campaign for president is not for me. https://www.facebook.com/6290032613/posts/10155021358512614/ …

text: .@JoeBiden: “Whether or not I run, whoever runs, I’m going to break my neck to make sure they win...We can’t have four more years.”

text: .@JoeBiden once again said a 2020 run will be a family decision. “I have 2 young grandchildren my son left who love me and adore me and want me around. I want to be there to take care of them, so we’ve got to figure out whether or not this is something we can all do as a family."
author: ArletteSaenz

text: In Missoula tonight, @JoeBiden said, "I think I’m the most qualified person in the country to be president...The issues that we face as a country today are the issues that have been in my wheelhouse, that I’ve worked on my whole life," said decision coming in 6 weeks to 2 months
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JoeBiden asking for donations for American Possibilities PAC: Impressive as last month's victory was, we can't allow ourselves to feel satisfied or complacent. So let's keep moving, folks.

text: .@JoeBiden sends e-mail through his PAC outlining 3 lessons of 2018. 1) “We can accomplish big, important things if we stick together.” 2) “If we want to create our best chance to win future elections, we need to compete in every corner of the map.” 3) "We have to stay focused."
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Biden reflected on a visit he made to Houston, said Bush insisted on visiting him, despite recently being hospitalized: “He said ‘I just came to welcome you to Houston & to tell you how badly I feel about Beau. He was an incredible young man & I think he may have been president'"
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JoeBiden on @GeorgeHWBush: We were on opposite sides of the political fence. I served the entire time that he was president. I’ve been there with 8 presidents as an elected official, and none of them had more class and greater sense of decency than President Bush
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Several @MGMResortsIntl properties on the Vegas strip are running a tribute to @GeorgeHWBush: Today we mourn the passing of an honorable man who loved and served his country. President George H.W. Bush was a great American, a dedicated family man, and a leader we all could admire
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Hallie Biden adds, “Tim, I’m sure Beau & your mom are looking down on us now excited to see how we will impact the lives of millions of @SpecialOlympics athletes & I thank you from the bottom of my heart. It means the world to me & to my children & to our entire Biden family”

text: Biden made his closing pitch for Dems at twelves rallies in eight states last week. I talked to voters at those rallies about his 2020 prospects, and the verdict about whether he should run was mixed.

text: Hurd writes of her meeting w/ Biden: “It happened to be my birthday, and he brought me flowers and a handwritten card. He was so gracious. A real class act. And taller in person than I'd imagined!” She then asks people to donate to his PAC to “support a new class of leaders”
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Alice Hurd, an 81-year-old grandmother from Kent, Ohio, recently won a contest to meet @JoeBiden on the trail. Today, she sends a fundraising email for his American Possibilities PAC with the subject line, “Joe Biden is taller in person.”

text: John Marttila, a former advisor to Joe Biden, passed away. “He really changed the way American campaigns are run,” Biden told the Globe. “He was one of the finest men — this is no exaggeration — that I’ve ever met.”

author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JoeBiden cites Fannie Lou Hamer's quote "I'm sick and tired of being sick and tired." Biden then puts his own spin on it, "I am sick and tired of this administration. I am sick and tired of what's going on. I'm sick and tired of being sick and tired, and I hope you are too."

text: .@JoeBiden takes the stage with rolled up sleeves in Madison, Wisconsin. Between now and Thursday he has eight events in six states (WI, IA, IL, MO, ND, MI)

text: .@JoeBiden may be in Ohio today, but he already seems to have Iowa on his mind. In Youngstown, he just accidentally referred to "Iowans" then corrected himself to "Ohioans" and "Buckeyes." He'll campaign for Abby Finkenauer in Cedar Rapids, tomorrow
author: ArletteSaenz

text: Asked if he'd support holding a Kavanaugh vote on Friday, Sen. Jeff Flake told me at the airport this morning "Depends on where we are with the FBI investigation"
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake: I for one am waiting for the additional information that will come from the supplemental FBI investigation to inform my decision on Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination.
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake: The compromise that Chris [Coons] and I struck on Friday is one that I take seriously. And we did it because fairness required us to do it and we did it because in that moment our impulse to tribalism was tearing the country apart.
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake: It sounds like I’m calling for a new politics. It’s because I am. We simply cannot go on this way.
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake: I’m a proud conservative & lifelong Republican. That does not make Democrats my enemies. America has too many real enemies to indulge such non-sense. We ill-serve our constituents when our tribal impulses take over and we cease to have a human response to each other
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake: Tribalism is ruining us. It is tearing our country apart. It is no way for sane adults to act and most importantly, ultimately, the only tribe to which any of us owes allegiance is the American tribe.
author: ArletteSaenz

text: .@JeffFlake says at New Hampshire Institute of Politics, "I have failed my tribe. I’ve been failing my tribe for some time now." He adds, "I hope to continue to fail my tribe."
